sen.j: 氏子内親王（うじこないしんのう、生年不詳 - 仁和元年4月2日 (旧暦)（885年5月19日））は、平安時代前期の皇族。
sen.e: Imperial Princess Ujiko (date of birth unknown-May 19, 885) was a member of the imperial family in the first half of the Heian period.
Imperial Princess Ujiko (date of birth unknown-May 19, 885) was a member of the imperial family during the first half of the Heian period.
Imperial Princess Ujiko (year of birth unknown - May 23, 885) was a member of the Imperial Family during the first half of the Heian period.
sen.cmt: 用語統一グレゴリオ暦に

sen.e: Ise Saigu (vestal virgin princess serving at Ise-jingu Shrine).
Ise Saigu (vestal virgin princess serving at Ise-jingu Shrine).
Ise Saigu (vestal virgin princess serving at Ise-jingu Shrine).

sen.j: 淳和天皇の第1皇女で、母は贈皇后高志内親王（桓武天皇皇女）。
sen.e: She was the first princess of Emperor Junna, and her mother was Prince Koshi (titled Empress after her death) (princess of Emperor Kanmu).
She was the first princess of Emperor Junna, and her mother was Prince Koshi (given the title Empress after her death) (princess of Emperor Kanmu).
She was the first princess of Emperor Junna, and her mother was Prince Koshi (given the title Empress after her death) (princess of Emperor Kanmu).

sen.j: 同母兄弟に恒世親王・有子内親王・貞子内親王がいた。
sen.e: Imperial Prince Tsuneyo, Imperial Princess Ariko, Imperial Princess Sadako were her siblings with the same mother.
Imperial Prince Tsuneyo, Imperial Princess Ariko, Imperial Princess Sadako were her siblings by the same mother.
Imperial Prince Tsuneyo, Imperial Princess Ariko, Imperial Princess Sadako were her siblings by the same mother.

sen.j: 仁子内親王（嵯峨天皇皇女）の退下を受けて、弘仁14年（823年）6月3日に父淳和天皇の斎宮になる。
sen.e: After Imperial Princess Jinshi (daughter of Emperor Saga) resigned, she became a Saigu (Imperial Princess appointed to serve the deities of the Ise-jingu Shrine) of her father, Emperor Junna on June 3 in 823.

After Imperial Princess Jinshi (daughter of Emperor Saga) resigned, she became Saigu (Imperial Princess appointed to serve the deities of the Ise-jingu Shrine) of her father, Emperor Junna on June 3 in 823.

After Imperial Princess Jinshi (daughter of Emperor Saga) resigned, she became Saigu (Imperial Princess appointed to serve the deities of the Ise-jingu Shrine) of her father, Emperor Junna on July 18, 823.

sen.j: 天長4年（827年）2月26日病により退下し、宣子女王（仲野親王女）と交替した。
sen.e: On February 26, 827, she resigned her position for her disease; Princess Yoshiko (daughter of Imperial Prince Nakano) took over the position.
On February 26, 827, she resigned her position because of a disease; Princess Yoshiko (daughter of Imperial Prince Nakano) took over the position.
On March 30, 827, she resigned her position because of a disease; Princess Yoshiko (daughter of Imperial Prince Nakano) took over the position.
On April 2, 885, she passed away.
On April 2, 885, she passed away.
On May 23, 885, she passed away.
